subject: Programming
title: John Backus and FORTRAN
description: A micro-lesson that makes John Backus and FORTRAN usable.

hook.text: John Backus hated programming. So he invented a language that made it easier for everyone.

buildup.text: At IBM, he led the team that created FORTRAN â€” the first widely used high-level language.

discovery.text: FORTRAN let scientists write formulas directly. Code that took weeks in assembly took hours.

twist.text: Critics said high-level code would be too slow. FORTRAN's compiler matched hand-written assembly speed.

climax.text: Backus later invented BNF notation, which formally describes the grammar of every language since.

punchline.text: Laziness inspired the first great language.

quiz.question: Why did John Backus create FORTRAN?
options: He found programming in assembly too tedious
